page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF FENWICK
page.content: This part of the map consists of mainly enclosed rough grazing used by cattle and sheep. There are approximately 15 farms, the majority of them being dairy. The village of Fenwick covers around 2\ square kilometres. It is a close knit community sporting a public park, library, public house and two garages, one of which has maintenance facilities available. Most of the land lying outside Fenwick is rough pasture with cattle grazing. Fenwick is 27km from Glasgow, to the north; to the wes Stewarton - 5km and to the south Kilmarnock - 7km. Also Fenwick has 3 small grocery shops where most provisions can be purchased.
